Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a bust of Zeus-Sarapis with an eagle in front, flanked by the sun and moon and surrounded by a wreath. Between the wick-hole and discus-rim are small volutes. At the rear is an unpierced notched handle. The lamp stands on a raised base.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2064)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Museum of Practical Geology
